revised_title: Experiments on the Point of Mercurial Congelation in Hudson's Bay
tldr: The author, Thomas Hutchins, conducts experiments to determine the freezing point of mercury in Albany Fort, Hudson's Bay, using thermometers and freezing mixtures. The experiments reveal that mercury freezes at 40 degrees below the zero mark. The author also shares Dr. Joseph Black's letter, which provides additional insights and suggestions for conducting similar experiments.
